title: Semolina Pasta Dough
introduction: Semolina flour, made from hard durum wheat, is the foundation of many traditional pasta varieties hailing from southern Italy. Known for its chewy texture, this type of pasta pairs beautifully with hearty meat and vegetable sauces, making it a versatile choice for a variety of dishes.
ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
instructions: In the bowl of a food processor or heavy-duty stand mixer, stir together the dry ingredients. Gradually add water to make a stiff, nonsticky dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth, about 2 minutes.
Cover the dough with a bowl and let rest 30 minutes. Dust two large baking sheets with flour.

Cut the dough into 8 pieces. Work with one piece at a time, keeping the remaining pieces covered with an overturned bowl. On a lightly floured surface, roll one piece of the dough into a long rope about 1/2 inch thick. Shape the dough into cavatelli or orrecchiette.
